messages.message:
Hi team, sharing a pretty major issue that our Deloitte Australia partner had while trying to demo a use case to a client today. The client came in person to the Deloitte offices to see a solution that they had built with help from our team over the last few weeks, but downtime/maintenance to the US MT env during their daytime meant they were not able to show anything.

How can we stop this happening again (particularly for our international opportunities that often are online during US night)?

cc @Piyush @Aditi @subbu @Josh Rad
@Hamish Today when they reported the issue, it was not downtime but regular weekly maintenance window and upgrade was in progress.
Thanks @arun. This is just as big an issue (or possibly worse) - did we notify them of downtime during this period?
Do we have a public facing documentation of these downtimes anywhere?

We do notify only in case of emergency maintenance or unplanned outages. For regular maintenance window, we do not send notification every week and the understanding is that the customers are already aware of this window. This is the same process followed for our Enterprise customers.

@sudeep Can you please help here?
> Do we have a public facing documentation of these downtimes anywhere?

So can someone confirm that Deloitte had / have a way of knowing these scheduled downtime windows? What is that process?
They claim that they had no upfront knowledge of the downtime

Ticket came from Deloitte as soon as the maintenance window started. They were not aware of regular maintenance window. All our Enterprise customers are aware of the regular maintenance windows. I believe this is discussed in the contract stage on the regular maintenance window timings agreed upon.
cc: @Ashish @sudeep

I'm not even aware of when our maintenance windows are, so I doubt Deloitte were. It seems like in the case of MT customers there might be a gap between sales/product/CE between who/how we communicate these downtimes to customers
most saas product would have a pop up/banner in app, can we do something like that?

Also, we may or may not have contracts in place with partners before they start selling / demoing the product. As such, we need to create a process where they are aware of these times. @Piyush - who would be the best people to speak to, to set a notification process for partners on scheduled downtime?
Ok great. I'll set something up for the team.

@Aditi @Hamish @Filippo
Sorry this happened, better messaging of planned maintenance and notifications are definitely on the team's radar and should be better addressed *this quarter* by extending the in-app banner notice for at least 48 hours before maintenance starts, and auto-emailing customers in advance. The two tickets addressing those are:
https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-3495
https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-3695

In the meantime, the best we can do is make sure clients are aware that maintenance for US MT environments occurs late at night EST time. @jtau can you confirm the exact start and end times of maintenance to US MT so the team here can note them down and educate customers?

Also @jtau, if an international customer (e.g. based in Australia) is on a US MT instance, does this mean they are bound to EST maintenance times? Wonder if there is a way for us to address this.

Also it appears that US MT deployment this weekend took longer than usual, which led to this issue - more details to come via company-wide email from Ashish on the reasons for the extended deployment time.
Thanks @Josh Rad appreciate the detailed response :slightly_smiling_face: Is it always Sundays that maintenance occurs on?

@Hamish The typical maintenance window starts from 7am IST until noon IST on  every Monday morning. For ANZ, it will be 12:30 - 5:30 pm IST. This will cover all customers maintenance except Citi(Mondays). Maintenance typically lasts 1-2 hours, assuming no issues arise during the process.
